Detailed Description

This class is the basic block of a graph. Each block is specialized in performing a task such as reading from an audio or video device, writing to a video surface or audio output, injecting data into the network. A Block can act as a source, sink or filter. Each block runs into a separate thread and has a control pin on which it waits for control commands. Each block inherits from ConfigTable so that it can store configuration parameters as strings (see ConfigTable for info).

Definition at line 47 of file block.hpp.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum uStreamLib::Block::ActionID
 

Action handlers identifiers. Each code is an index in the action handlers table, provided by a block.

Enumeration values:
ACTION_DATA_PRODUCE  invoked when source needs to produce data
ACTION_DATA_CONSUME  invoked when sink needs to consume data
ACTION_DATA_FILTER  invoked when filter needs to filter data
ACTION_LAST_USED_ID  last used action id plus 1
ACTION_MAX_ID  maximum id for these indexes

Definition at line 62 of file block.hpp.

enum uStreamLib::Block::BlockType
 

Block types. This enum contains constants that define block types.

Enumeration values:
TYPE_SOURCE  the block produces data (source)
TYPE_FILTER  the block filters data (filter)
TYPE_SINK  the block consumes data (sink)

Definition at line 53 of file block.hpp.

enum uStreamLib::Block::EventID
 

Event handlers identifiers. Each code is an index in the event handler table, provided by a block. Each event has a meaning if you give it a meaning.

Enumeration values:
EVENT_RESET  make the block do a reset
EVENT_START  start the block
EVENT_STOP  stop the block
EVENT_PAUSE  make the block do a pause
EVENT_BUFFERIZE  make the block bufferize the data
EVENT_SEEK  make the block do a seek
EVENT_TELL  get total amount of data
EVENT_SKIP  make the block skip data
EVENT_QUIT  quit this block
EVENT_DATA_READY  data ready on input pins
EVENT_TIMEOUT  timeout event
EVENT_TERMINATE  terminate the block (stronger than quit)
EVENT_COMMAND  execute specific command
EVENT_LAST_USED_ID  last used event id plus 1
EVENT_MAX_ID  maximum id for these indexes

Enumeration values:

enum uStreamLib::Block::LockTableID
 

Lock/Unlock constants. Constants to use in lock/unlock.

Enumeration values:
INPUT_TABLE  Lock input table
OUTPUT_TABLE  Lock output table
ALL_TABLES  Lock all tables

Definition at line 130 of file block.hpp.

enum uStreamLib::Block::StatusID
 

Status identifiers. Each id is returned by getStatus() method. Use getStatusString() to get a string rapresentation of these numbers.

Enumeration values:
STATUS_READY  the block is ready
STATUS_STARTED  the block is started
STATUS_STOPPED  the block is stopped
STATUS_PAUSED  the block is paused
STATUS_SEEKING  the block is performing a seek
STATUS_SKIPPING  the block is performing a skip
STATUS_BUFFERIZING  the block is bufferizing data
STATUS_RESETTING  the block is performing a reset
STATUS_QUITTING  the block is quitting
STATUS_TERMINATING  the block is terminating
STATUS_TELLING  the block is performing a tell
STATUS_ERROR  the block is in an error condition

Member Function Documentation

int32 uStreamLib::Block::attachActionHandler (  int32  action_id,
BlockHandler *  handler
) 
 

Attach action handler to a specific event. You can create an action handler object and then attach it to a specific action by invoking this method. An action handler is a piece of code that will be run when a block needs to perform an action such as produce data (for a source), consume data (for a sink) or filter data (for a filter, of course).

Parameters:
action_id the action id to attache the handler to.
handler the action handler to attach.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if handler cannot be attached.

Definition at line 533 of file block.cpp.

int32 uStreamLib::Block::attachEventHandler (  int32  event_id,
BlockHandler *  handler
) 
 

Attach event handler to a specific event. You can create an event handler object and then attach it to a specific event by invoking this method. An event handler is a piece of code that will be run when an event occurs. Events are STOP, PAUSE, RESET and so on as stated by a specific enum defined in this block.

Parameters:
event_id the event id to attach the handler to.
handler the event handler to attach.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if handler cannot be attached.

Definition at line 386 of file block.cpp.

DataPin * uStreamLib::Block::createDataPin (  char *  name,
uint8  dir,
uint32  bufsz,
uint32  bufco,
int32  queuesz
) 
 

Use this method to create a data pin. The returned datapin is already added to the right pins table (i.e. pins with output direction to output pins table and those with input direction to input pins table).

Parameters:
name pin's name (used as identifier)
dir pin's direction, one of DIR_INPUT or DIR_OUTPUT
bufsz preferred buffer size.
bufco preferred buffers count.
queuesz preferred queue size.
Returns:
a pointer to the created pin.

Definition at line 372 of file block.cpp.

int32 uStreamLib::Block::init (  BlockManager *  bm,
char *  name,
uint32  bufsz = US_CP_BUFSZ,
uint32  bufcount = US_CP_BUFCO,
int32  queuesz = US_CP_QUEUESZ
)  [protected]
 

Initialize a block. A block has a descriptive name and one ControlPin. A Block can have input or output DataPins based on the specified type. A source has only output DataPins; a sink has only input DataPins and a filter has both input and output DataPins.

Parameters:
bm a pointer to the block manager.
name a descriptive name of this block.
bufsz preferred control pin's buffer size.
bufcount preferred control pin's buffers count.
queuesz control pin's internal priority queue size.

Reimplemented in uStreamLib::Filter, uStreamLib::Sink, and uStreamLib::Source.

Definition at line 122 of file block.cpp.

void uStreamLib::Block::lockTable (  int32  what  ) 
 

This method locks internal pins tables. You need to call this method when you are using enumerations of input or output pins.

Parameters:
what which table to lock (INPUT_TABLE, OUTPUT_TABLE, ALL_TABLES).

Definition at line 563 of file block.cpp.

int32 uStreamLib::Block::notifyPeersOf (  DataPin *  dp  ) 
 

This method notifies of data arrival every peer connected to the specified data pin. Use this method to awake blocks so that they can process arriving data.

Parameters:
dp data pin whose peers need to be awoken.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE.

Definition at line 450 of file block.cpp.

int32 uStreamLib::Block::sendMessageToPeersOf (  DataPin *  dp,
uint32  code
) 
 

This method make a block able to send specific control messages to all connected peers for a specific data pin. For example, a block can stop, reset or control in some way all connected blocks in a chain.

Parameters:
dp the data pin whose blocks must receive the message
code the message to send (EVENT_* messages).
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if message cannot be sent.
